item.title: BB buys $223.50m through dollar auction
item.description: Bangladesh Bank (BB) on Tuesday purchased US$223.50 million from 14 commercial banks through multiple auction methods as part of its ongoing strategy to curb the depreciation of the US dollar against the taka and revitalise the remittance and export sectors. According to central bank data, it boug

item.title: Experts concerned over depletion of marine fisheries stocks
item.description: Bangladesh’s deep-sea ecosystem is under mounting pressure from overfishing, aggressive industrial practices and plastic pollution, according to new findings presented to the country’s chief adviser on Tuesday, prompting calls for urgent research-driven policy intervention. The warning

item.title: NCP accuses EC officials of bias ahead of election
item.description: National Citizen Party (NCP) on Tuesday warned that democracy is at risk, accusing senior government officials, including intelligence chiefs, of openly favoring a party ahead of the national election. “We’ve seen various government officials and chiefs of different intelligence agenci

item.title: EC vows transparent, impartial conduct of polls: EC Sanaullah
item.description: Election Commissioner Brigadier General (Retd.) Abul Fazal Md. Sanaullah on Tuesday said there is no concern regarding the upcoming national elections scheduled for February 12, assuring that the Election Commission (EC) will discharge its duties with transparency, impartiality and firmness. He sa

item.title: DSE ends lower after early gains, CSE maintains uptrend
item.description: Trading at the Bangladesh capital market ended mixed on Tuesday, the third working day of the week, as the Dhaka Stock Exchange (DSE) failed to sustain early gains while the Chittagong Stock Exchange (CSE) closed higher. After opening on a positive note, the DSE slipped into negative territory by

item.title: Maduro opponent Machado vows to return to Venezuela, wants election
item.description: Venezuela’s main opposition leader Maria Corina Machado has vowed to return home quickly, praising U.S. President Donald Trump for toppling her enemy Nicolas Maduro and declaring her movement ready to win a free election. Trump appears, however, to hope for now to work with interim President

item.title: ACC prosecutes Sadiq Abdullah over failure to submit wealth statement
item.description: The Anti-Corruption Commission (ACC) has filed a case against former Barishal City Corporation mayor Serneabat Sadiq Abdullah for failing to submit his statement of assets within the stipulated time. On Tuesday, ACC Director General Md Akhtar Hossain said the case was filed in Dhaka by the commiss

item.title: Japan funds school transport, classroom expansion projects
item.description: Japan has extended a grant of about BDT 13.8m (USD 115,723) to two Bangladeshi non-governmental organisations to support education-focused projects aimed at improving safety and access for vulnerable children, the Japanese embassy in Dhaka said on Tuesday. The funding, provided under Japan’s

item.title: Conservation must be given priority in St. Martin’s Island master plan: Rizwana
item.description: Environment, Forest and Climate Change and Water Resources Adviser Syeda Rizwana Hasan on Tuesday stressed giving priority to conservation in the proposed “Master Plan of Saint Martin’s Island”. Saint Martin’s Island has been declared an ecologically critical area, an

item.title: Celebration of English New Year by NRBC Bank
item.description: NRBC Bank has celebrated the arrival of the English New Year 2026 with a modest ceremony at the bank's headquarters. The chief guest for the occasion was Md. item.title: SBAC Bank signs agreement to participate in Bangladesh Bank's Start-up Fund
item.description: SBAC Bank PLC has signed an agreement to participate an agreement in the Bangladesh Bank Start-up Refinance Fund of Tk 500 crore to facilitate innovation and the development of new entrepreneurs. item.title: IFIC Bank, Shopping Bag Supermarket sign MoU to offer exclusive benefits for customers
item.description: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) has been signed between IFIC Bank PLC and Shopping Bag Supermarket, one of the premier retail destinations in Chattogram, according to a press release.
